config-setting-maxclientviewdistance-com: Limits the max view distance of all players so they can't eat up all of the disk space. Increase this on the server to increase view distance for players. Ignored in Singleplayer and in 'Open to LAN' worlds. Note: Players can't see the server-side limit in the GUI, unlike with normal view distance.
config-setting-heightmapgridsize-comment: Increasing this will make heightmaps more detailed, but also increase the file size and bandwidth use exponentially. Value should be a power of two (32, 64, 128, 256...). 512 is the max value, and samples the heightmap at every block. If changing this on an existing world, be sure to remove the database file for that world first (VintageStoryData/Farseer Directory) to reset existing regions.
config-setting-genrealchunks-comment: If true, generates and saves actual chunks up until the set 'far view distance'. When false, only chunks within normal view distance are saved.
config-setting-chunkgenqueuethreshold-co: If more than this number of chunks are currently being generated, halts generating any far terrain heightmaps until that number is lower again. Prevents server overload. Max Value: 2000.
config-setting-disableprogresslogging-co: If true, stops spamming the Server Log with far region generation progress reports.
